text.p: TORONTO, Aug 18 Reuter) - The following are top headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Haitian police ill-equipped: Officials fear chaos will erupt when UN force leaves unprepared officers behind
-Verbal dexterity of no use to Olson: B.C. killer seeks parole hearing
-Change 'unavoidable' for Ontario Hydro: Giant utility's woes mean a competitive market 'is now inevitable'
-Bosnian Serbs threaten NATO: Helicopters trying to snatch Karadzic from stronghold would be shot down
-Past comes back to haunt Nova Scotia: Legal actions uncover some evidence that provincial officials were aware of allegations of abuse involving children in institutions in early 1960s.
-Hydro's woes could boost rivals: Ontario's independent power producers hope to increase output as utility closes sites
-UPS strikers win over public: But unionization on the wane
-Developer builds on his O&Y past: With lessons learned from the Reichmans, Michael Dennis returns to his Toronto roots.
-Eaton's unveils plan: Restructuring blueprint promises to pay debts in full with cash and notes but the big question is, will it be enough to win over creditors
-Mutual funds: How bad could a bear market be?
